roleset.name: bring back to life from death, sleep or dormancy
roleset.note: REVIVE-V NOTES: Resolving trace chains seems particularly difficult for this verb;dunno why.VN, FN updated by Julia. Member of VNcls 45.4. (from revive.01-v)

role.descr: thing or system being brought back
specifica aspect of arg1 being revived

example.name: revive-v: nice and simple
example.text: One investment banker said Mr. Steinberg may be trying to position himself as a friendly investor who could help UAL Chairman Stephen Wolf revive a failed labor-management bid.

example.name: revive-v: targetless traces
example.text: Although takeover experts said they doubted Mr. Steinberg will make a bid by himself, the application by his Reliance Group Holdings Inc. could signal his-1 interest in *trace*-1 helping *trace*-1 revive a failed labor-management bid.

example.name: revival-n
example.text: Asia is on alert to signs of Japan's military revival.

example.name: revival-n: with arg2
example.text: The economic revival of the Federal Republic of Germany (FRG) in the two decades following the second world war saw a period of unprecedented growth
example.arg: of the Federal Republic of Germany (FRG)
in the two decades following the second world war
